Helena Iturvides Cimarosti

Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq - Nível 2

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/4200182415423035
  • Última atualização do currículo em 30/08/2019

Graduada em Farmácia e Bioquímica pela Universidade Católica de Pelotas (1998), Mestre (2001) e Doutora (2005) em Ciências Biológicas (Bioquímica) pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (doutorado-sanduíche no Florey Institute of Neuroscience and Mental Health, Universidade de Melbourne, Austrália, 2003 - 2004). Pós-doutorado na Universidade de Bristol, Grã-Bretanha (2006 - 2009), como bolsista Marie Curie e subsequentemente pesquisadora associada. De 2010 a 2014 atuou como Lecturer in Pharmacology da Universidade de Reading, Grã-Bretanha. Sabático de pesquisa na Universidade de Kyoto, Japão (Jun-Set 2012). Desde 2015 é Professora Adjunta do Departamento de Farmacologia da Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina. Extensa experiência nas áreas de Bioquímica, Farmacologia e Neurociências. As principais linhas de pesquisa envolvem isquemia cerebral, doença de Alzheimer, doença de Parkinson, neuroproteção, plasticidade sináptica, sinalização celular e modificação pós-traducional de proteínas. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2012 - Atual
Balance between neurogenesis and gliogenesis in neural stem cells: Role of protein SUMOylation
Descrição: The success of neuronal regeneration following severe cerebral injuries such as ischemia strongly depends on the balance between neurogenesis and gliogenesis in the brain. Determining the regulatory mechanisms of protein SUMOylation in cellular differentiation therefore constitutes an important challenge and might ultimately provide targets for therapeutic intervention. This project focuses on the potential role of protein SUMOylation in regulating the differentiation of neural precursors into either neuronal or glial cells..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Integrante / KAGEYAMA, R. - Coordenador.
2011 - 2011
Investigating organotypic hippocampal slice culture responses to amyloid beta fragment incubation using multi-electrode array electrophysiological techniques
Descrição: Central proteins implicated in the pathology of Alzheimer's disease (AD) are SUMO targets and SUMOylation has been shown to be significantly altered in a transgenic mouse model of AD. However, the functional consequences of protein SUMOylation in AD still remain elusive. This project aims to determine the effects of SUMOylation on neuronal functions in AD-like conditions by electrophysiological recordings from organotypic hippocampal slices adhered to sealed multi-electrode arrays..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Coordenador / WHALLEY, B.J. - Integrante / SALBEGO, C. - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico - Bolsa.
Número de produções C, T & A: 2
2011 - Atual
Understanding the pathways of reactive astrogliosis
Descrição: Astrocytes have been shown to significantly influence the brain in developing and adult stages, under normal as well as pathological conditions. The morphological phenomenon known as reactive astrogliosis should not only represent a marker for CNS injury, but regulate the healing process and potentially help to re-establish equilibrium during pathological conditions. The aim of this project is to determine potential reactivity regulators in astrocytes and to correlate treatment-derived morphological changes with atypical functional property changes..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Integrante / RATTRAY, M. - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council - Bolsa.
2011 - Atual
Evaluation and mechanisms of novel neuroprotective compounds for the treatment of motor neuron disease
Descrição: The 2-benzothiazoleamine Riluzole has been shown to prevent neuronal loss and prolong survival of Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) patients by around 7 months. A variety of 2-benzothiazoleamine derivatives have been synthesized in our lab in order to generate novel compounds with a similar pharmacological profile to Riluzole, but with improved neuroprotective potency. The main focus of this project is the determination of the neuroprotective potential of novel Riluzole derivatives and to find potential candidates with the capacity to inhibit motor neuron loss in ALS patients..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Integrante / RATTRAY, M. - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Motor Neuron Disease Association - Bolsa.
2010 - 2011
SUMOylation-dependent down-regulation of the JNK pathway as a potential therapeutic target in cerebral ischemia
Descrição: A dramatic increase in protein SUMOylation can be observed in the brains of ischemic and hibernating animals, suggesting the possibility that SUMOylation may be neuroprotective. This project will test the hypothesis that SUMOylation protects neurons from ischemia by decreasing the activity of pathways instructing neurons to die, e.g. the c-Jun N-terminal kinase (JNK) pathway..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Royal Society - Auxílio financeiro.
Número de produções C, T & A: 5
2010 - Atual
Is SUMOylation of calcium channels involved in brain ischemia?
Descrição: It has been shown that protein SUMOylation decreases presynaptic calcium influx and glutamate release; however, the target proteins and the molecular mechanisms involved remain unknown.The main scientific objective of this project is the examination of SUMOylation-dependent down-regulation of calcium channels as this may provide a therapeutic approach to reduce ischemia-induced excitotoxicity and subsequent neuronal death..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Coordenador / STEPHENS, G. - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Research Endowment Trust Fund - Bolsa.
Número de produções C, T & A: 2
2010 - Atual
Understanding glutamate transporter down-regulation in neurodegenerative disease: Role of calpain
Descrição: EAAT2/GLT-1 is abundant in astrocytes in the healthy brain, but significantly and rapidly reduced in neurodegenerative diseases. The calcium-activated cysteine protease, calpain, has long been associated with neurodegeneration, with calpain inhibitors conferring neuroprotection in a number of injury states. The two main aims of this project are to determine: 1) how GLT-1 is regulated by calpain, by defining the sites of calpain cleavage or the calpain-sensitive GLT-1 interactors and 2) whether calpain activation is required for down-regulation of GLT-1 under a range of experimental conditions which mimic aspects of neurodegeneration..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Helena Iturvides Cimarosti - Integrante / RATTRAY, M. - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Alzheimer's Society - Bolsa.
